speedrun: Akido Labs, a medical startup in Southern California, is using large language models (LLMs) to streamline patient appointments and diagnoses. This innovative approach allows patients to spend less time in clinics while improving efficiency. By leveraging AI, Akido Labs could enhance the overall healthcare experience. This development is significant as it marks a step toward integrating AI more deeply into everyday medical practices.
why_it_matters: Patients could benefit from shorter wait times and quicker diagnoses, improving their overall healthcare experience.
This trend indicates a broader shift in healthcare towards AI-driven solutions, potentially transforming how medical services are delivered.

lenses.eli12: Akido Labs is using AI to help doctors see patients faster. Imagine if a smart assistant could handle scheduling and simple questions, freeing up doctors for more complex cases. This matters because it could make healthcare more efficient and accessible for everyone.
lenses.pm: For product managers and founders, Akido Labs' use of LLMs highlights a growing user need for efficiency in healthcare. By reducing appointment times, this approach could lower operational costs and improve patient satisfaction. A practical takeaway is to explore AI solutions that streamline processes in other industries.
lenses.engineer: Akido Labs is implementing LLMs to optimize patient interactions, which could significantly reduce the time spent on routine tasks. This model may leverage existing AI frameworks, focusing on natural language processing to facilitate smoother communication. While promising, the effectiveness and accuracy of these models in clinical settings will need ongoing evaluation.
